*Before attempting these questions, it is highly recommended that you read \[Guide: Definite integration\].*

## Q1 {.unnumbered}

Evaluate the following definite integrals with respect $x$.

1.1. $\displaystyle \quad \int_{1}^{4} 2 \, \mathrm{d}x$

1.2. $\displaystyle \quad \int_{-2}^{2} 3x \, \mathrm{d}x$

1.3. $\displaystyle \quad \int_{-2}^{1} \left( 3-5x \right) \, \mathrm{d}x$

1.4. $\displaystyle \quad \int_{2}^{4} 2x^3 \, \mathrm{d}x$

1.5. $\displaystyle \quad \int_{0}^{2} \left( 4x^2 - 3x + 1 \right) \, \mathrm{d}x$

1.6. $\displaystyle \quad \int_{-3}^{-1} \left( 6x^4 + 1 \right) \, \mathrm{d}x$

1.7. $\displaystyle \quad \int_{-2}^{2} \left( x-2 \right) \left( 2x+1 \right) \, \mathrm{d}x$

1.8. $\displaystyle \quad \int_{0}^{3} x^2 \left( 3x-2 \right) \, \mathrm{d}x$

## Q2 {.unnumbered}

Evaluate the following definite integrals with respect to $x$, using the power rule and the chain rule (or an appropriate substitution $u=ax+b$).

2.1. $\displaystyle \quad \int_{1}^{27} \dfrac{4}{\sqrt[3]{x}} \, \mathrm{d}x$

2.2. $\displaystyle \quad \int_{1}^{4} (2\sqrt{x} + x^2) \, \mathrm{d}x$

2.3. $\displaystyle \quad \int_{1}^{4} ( x^{3/2} - x^{-1/2} ) \, \mathrm{d}x$

2.4. $\displaystyle \quad \int_{0}^{3} ( 2x^3 - 7x + 5 ) \, \mathrm{d}x$

2.5. $\displaystyle \quad \int_{1}^{4} ( 6x^{-2} - 2x^{1/2} ) \, \mathrm{d}x$

2.6. $\displaystyle \quad \int_{0}^{1} (2x+1)^3 \, \mathrm{d}x$

2.7. $\displaystyle \quad \int_{-1}^{1} (4-3x)^2 \, \mathrm{d}x$

2.8. $\displaystyle \quad \int_{0}^{2} (1+x)^3 \, \mathrm{d}x$

2.9. $\displaystyle \quad \int_{1}^{4} \left( \dfrac{x}{2} - 3 \right)^2 \, \mathrm{d}x$

2.10. $\displaystyle \quad \int_{-1}^{1} (2x+3)^2 \, \mathrm{d}x$

## Q3 {.unnumbered}

Evaluate the following trigonometric definite integrals with respect to $x$, using the graphs of $\sin ( ax )$ and $\cos ( bx )$ to help you.

3.1. $\displaystyle \quad \int_{0}^{\pi/2} \sin ( x ) \, \mathrm{d}x$

3.2. $\displaystyle \quad \int_{0}^{\pi} \cos ( x ) \, \mathrm{d}x$

3.3. $\displaystyle \quad \int_{\pi/2}^{\pi} \sin ( x ) \, \mathrm{d}x$

3.4. $\displaystyle \quad \int_{\pi}^{2\pi} \sin ( x ) \, \mathrm{d}x$

3.5. $\displaystyle \quad \int_{0}^{3\pi/2} \sin ( x ) \, \mathrm{d}x$

3.6. $\displaystyle \quad \int_{0}^{\pi/4} \sin ( 2x ) \, \mathrm{d}x$

3.7. $\displaystyle \quad \int_{0}^{\pi} \sin ( 2x ) \, \mathrm{d}x$

3.8. $\displaystyle \quad \int_{\pi/4}^{3\pi/2} \cos ( 2x ) \, \mathrm{d}x$

3.9. $\displaystyle \quad \int_{\pi/4}^{\pi/2} \cos ( 2x ) \, \mathrm{d}x$

3.10. $\displaystyle \quad \int_{0}^{4\pi} \cos \left( \dfrac{x}{2} \right) \, \mathrm{d}x$

## Q4 {.unnumbered}

Evaluate the following trigonometric definite integrals with respect to $x$, using the graphs of $\sin ( ax )$ and $\cos ( bx )$ to help you.

4.1. $\displaystyle \quad \int_{0}^{\pi/6} \cos(2x) \, \mathrm{d}x$

4.2. $\displaystyle \quad \int_{-\pi/4}^{0} \sin(3x) \, \mathrm{d}x$

4.3. $\displaystyle \quad \int_{0}^{\pi/3} ( \sin(x) + \cos(x) ) \, \mathrm{d}x$

4.4. $\displaystyle \quad \int_{\pi/6}^{\pi/2} \cos\left(4x - \dfrac{\pi}{3}\right) \, \mathrm{d}x$

4.5. $\displaystyle \quad \int_{-\pi/6}^{\pi/6} \sin(x) \, \mathrm{d}x$

4.6. $\displaystyle \quad \int_{0}^{\pi/2} \cos\left(2x + \dfrac{\pi}{6}\right) \, \mathrm{d}x$

4.7. $\displaystyle \quad \int_{-\pi/3}^{\pi/3} \sin(5x) \, \mathrm{d}x$

4.8. $\displaystyle \quad \int_{\pi/6}^{\pi/4} ( \cos(x) - \sin(x) ) \, \mathrm{d}x$

4.9. $\displaystyle \quad \int_{0}^{\pi/4} \cos(6x) \, \mathrm{d}x$

4.10. $\displaystyle \quad \int_{-\pi/6}^{\pi/6} \sin\left(3x - \dfrac{\pi}{4}\right) \, \mathrm{d}x$
